However, there are also brands like Linjer that are young and tired of big name brands charging far more than the actual cost of manufacturing the watch.

Linjer use the same quality materials as the luxury brands on the outside such as sapphire domed glass and Italian, full-grain vegetable tanned leather for their straps.

And on the inside, it’s the same ETA 2824-2 movement powering the watch.

The difference is they’re charging only a few hundred dollars; are completely transparent when it comes to how their watches are made; and even manage to beat prices of well-known fashion brands (rhymes with Nathaniel Smellington) selling poorly built watches.

https://www.themodestman.com/watch-movements/
